meanings.definition: The unit of force in the International System of Units, equal to the force that produces an acceleration of one meter per second per second on a mass of one kilogram.
meanings.sent1: A newton can make an object move faster.
meanings.sent2: She measured the force in newtons using a special scale.
meanings.sent3: The newton decided to take a break from pushing things around.
meanings.sent4: His determination was like a newton, propelling him forward.
meanings.sent5: The newton's impact was felt throughout the experiment.

meanings.definition: A fig tree of the Mediterranean region, widely cultivated for its edible fruit.
meanings.sent1: The newton tree in the garden bears delicious fruits.
meanings.sent2: We enjoyed the sweet taste of the newton figs.
meanings.sent3: The newton tree whispered secrets to the other plants.
meanings.sent4: The newton tree stood tall, offering shade and sustenance.
meanings.sent5: The newton figs were a delightful addition to the meal.
